Class TileBag

java.lang.Object
TileBag
public class TileBag extends Object
TileBag class for the Scrabble game. It manages all the tiles. It contains 100 tiles with normal Scrabble distribution. It also gives ways to draw random tiles and check if empty.

      private List<Tile> tiles

    • random

      private Random random

  • Constructor Details

    • TileBag

      public TileBag()
      Constructor starts the tile bag with 100 tiles. Tiles are then shared/distributed according to Scrabble rules.

  • Method Details

    • initializeTiles

      private void initializeTiles()
      Initializes the bag according to Scrabble rules of distribution. There is a total of 100 tiles The distribution works like this : 1 point : E x 12, Ax9, Ix9, Ox8, Nx6, Rx6, Tx6, Lx4, Sx4, Ux4, 2 points : Dx4,Gx3, 3 points : Bx2, Cx2, Mx2, Px2 4 points : Fx2, Hx2, Vx2, Wx2, Yx2 5 points : Kx1 8 points : Jx1, Xx1 10 points : Qx1, Zx1 0 points : Blank x2

    • addTiles

      private void addTiles(char character, int count)
      Adds multiple tiles of same letter.
      Parameters:
      character - the letter to add.
      count - the number of tiles to add.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the tile bag is empty.
      Returns:
      true if there are no tiles remaining and false if otherwise

    • getRandomTile

      public Tile getRandomTile()
      Draws a random tile from the bag. Removes and returns one tile from the bag.
      Returns:
      a random Tile, or null if hte bag is empty

    • returnTile

      public void returnTile(Tile tile)
      Returns a tile back to the bag. It is used when a player has switched tiles.
      Parameters:
      tile - the tile to return

    • getRemainingTiles

      public int getRemainingTiles()
      Gets the number of tiles remaining in the bag. Used for Test purposes in TileBagTest
      Returns:
      the number of tiles still remaining in the bag

    • displayInfo

      public void displayInfo()
      Displays the information about the tile bag It shows the remaining tile count Used for Test purposes in TileBagTest

    • getTiles

      public List<Tile> getTiles()
      Gets a list of the tile list This method is designed to help with test cases. Used for Test purposes in TileBagTest
      Returns:
      a list of the tiles

    • removeRandomTile

      public void removeRandomTile()
      Removes a random tile
